marytts.util.io

Class PropertiesAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.util.io.PropertiesAccessor

  • public class PropertiesAccessor
extends Object
    provide comfortable access to a properties, optionally overriding settings with system properties, and optionally providing string replacements.
    Author:
    marc

    • Constructor Summary

      PropertiesAccessor(Properties p, boolean letSystemPropertiesOverride, Map<String,String> stringReplacements)
      Initialise the properties accessor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertiesAccessor

        public PropertiesAccessor(Properties p)

      • PropertiesAccessor

        public PropertiesAccessor(Properties p,
                          boolean letSystemPropertiesOverride,
                          Map<String,String> stringReplacements)
        Initialise the properties accessor.
        Parameters:
        p - the properties to access
        letSystemPropertiesOverride - if true, any property will first be looked up in the system properties; only if it is not found there, it will be looked up in p
        stringReplacements - before → after pairs of string replacements to perform before returning any property values.

      • getStream

        public InputStream getStream(String propertyName)
                      throws FileNotFoundException,
                             MaryConfigurationException
        For the named property, attempt to get an open input stream. If the property value starts with "jar:", the remainder of the value is interpreted as an absolute path in the classpath. Otherwise it is interpreted as a file name.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of a property defined in one of the mary config files.
        Returns:
        an InputStream representing the given resource, or null if the property was not defined.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the property value is a file name and the file cannot be opened
        MaryConfigurationException - if the property value is a classpath entry which cannot be opened
